turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: "Yo soy un hombre sincero..." I am a sincere man, From the land of the palms...

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The song.  Are you sincere with me, Fredo?

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: Sincere.  What are you talking about, of course I'm sincere with you, Mike.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Then I'm going to confide in you; trust you with something.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: Mike, are you crazy, I'm your brother.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Tonight we've been invited to a reception at the Presidential Palace; to bring in the New Year. You and I will go in a special car that's being sent.  They'll have cocktails... then dinner, and a reception with the President.  When it's over, it will be suggested that you take Questadt and his friends from Washington to spend the night with some women.  I'll go home alone in the car; and before I reach the hotel, I'll be assassinated.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: ...Who?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The same man who tried in Nevada... Hyman Roth, not Pentangeli.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: But, you told me yourself...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It was never Pentangeli... I've always known that.  It was Roth all along.  He talks to me as a son; as his successor, but the old man thinks he'll live forever.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: To go tonight, with me, as though we know nothing.  I've already made my move.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: What is it?  Can I help?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The old man will never bring in the New Year.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Fredo.  Where are you going?

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: Nowhere, Mike.  I wanted to get a refill.  How about you?

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: I don't have a lot to say, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We have time.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: I was kept pretty much in the dark. I didn't know all that much.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What about now, is there anything you can help me out with?

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: I know they get Pentangeli, that's all I know.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: I didn't know it was a hit.  I swear to you I didn't know.  Johnny Ola contacted me in Beverly Hills -- said he wanted to talk.  He said you and Roth were in on some big deal, and there was a place for me in it if I could help them out. They said you were being tough on the negotiation, and if they had a little bit of help, they could close it fast and it would be good for you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And you believed that story.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: He said there was something good in it for me...me on my own.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've always taken care of you.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: Taken care of me.  Mike, you're my kid brother, and you take care of my.  Did you ever think of that. Ever once?  Send Fredo off to do this, send Fredo to take care of that... take care of some little unimportant night club here, and there; pick somebody up at the airport.  Mike, I'm your older brother; I was stepped over!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's the way Pop wanted it.

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: It wasn't the way I wanted it!  I can handle things.  I'm not dumb Christ, not like everyone says. I'm smart; and I want respect.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: There's nothing more you can tell me about this investigation?

turns.speaker: FREDO
turns.text: The lawyer; Questadt, he belongs to Roth.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're nothing to me now, Fredo; not a brother, not a friend, I don't want to know you, or what happens to you.  I don't want to see you at the hotels, or near my home.  When you visit our Mother, I want to know a day in advance, so I won't be there.  Do you understand?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: I know what you are thinking, Vitone, but you don't understand yet how things are.  Fanucci is of the Black Hand.  Everyone in the neighborhood pays him, even my father.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: He's an Italian?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: A pig of a Neaponitan.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Why?  Why does he bother other Italians?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Because he knows them; he knows they have no one to protect them. Vitone?  What do you think of my angel?

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Beautiful.

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Beautiful.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: For you, she is beautiful.  For me, there is only my wife!

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: I know.  That's why I brought you with me!

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: I bet you can't guess what happened?

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Some guys from Ninth Avenue jumped Fanucci today; slit his throat from ear to ear.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: No, I didn't know.  Is he dead?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Nah.  Those guys aren't murderers. They wanted to scare him, that's all.  Make him look bad.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: In Sicily, when you attack a man, you had better finish him.

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: I wish they had.  He takes fifty dollars a week from my father's cash drawer.  But you can't kill a man like Fanucci.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Because he's what we say... "connected"... You wait, see what happens to those guys from Ninth Avenue.

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: What did I tell you.  The one who cut him was found in an alley.  And the family of the others paid Fanucci all their savings to make him forswear his vengeance.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: And he agreed?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: He took the money.  Now he wants double from everybody in the neighborhood, including Papa.

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: The 'patrone' is here.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Chi?

turns.speaker: GENCO
turns.text: Roberto.  Who owns the 'rat-holes.'

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: It's Michael's request...for your safety.  We can send out for anything you need.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm supposed to stay in my house.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Within the compound will be fine.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I was supposed to take the children to New England next week.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: That's off now.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm going to see my parents.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Kay, Michael didn't tell me a lot; and what he did tell me, I can't repeat.  But the responsibility for you and the kids was the most important thing he left me with.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: How long does this go on?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm sorry, Kay...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Am I a prisoner?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: That's not the way we look at it.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: ... He said he had shot his Grandfather with a gun, and then he died in the garden.  And he asked me... he asked me, Tom, if that meant now his father would shoot him out of... revenge.  How does a four year old boy learn the word... 'revenge'?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Kay... Kay...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What kind of a family is this... are we human beings?  He knows his Father killed his Uncle Carlo.  He heard Connie.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: You don't know that's true.  But Kay, just for the sake of an argument, let's assume it is, I'm not saying it is, remember, but... What if I gave you what might be some justification for what he did... or rather some possible justification for what he possibly did.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: That's the first time I've seen the lawyer side of you, Tom.  It's not your best side.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Okay, just hear me out.  What if Carlo had been paid to help get Sonny killed?  What if his beating of Connie that time was a deliberate plot to get Sonny out into the open? Then what?  And what if the Don, a great man, couldn't bring himself to do what he had to do, avenge his son's death by killing his daughter's husband?  What if that, finally, was too much for him, and he made Michael his successor, knowing that Michael would take that load off his shoulders, would take that guilt?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: He's not the same as when I met him.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: If he were, he'd be dead by now. You'd be a widow.  You'd have no problem.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What the hell does that mean?  Come on, Tom, speak out straight once in your life.  I know Michael can't, but you're not Sicilian, you can tell a woman the truth; you can treat her like an equal, a fellow human being.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: If you told Michael what I've told you today, I'm a dead man.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: When is it finally over?  I want it to be over before my baby is born.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I hope soon; but it's not over yet, and that's why you and the kids have to come back to me.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Where's my wife?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: With Mama, putting the baby to sleep.  Francesca's very happy. Michael was kind to her.  She idolizes him.  The children are all out in the speedboat.  I'm going to my house.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: He doesn't want my help any more. He doesn't need it.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: We don't know that's true, he never said that.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I can feel it in the way he talks to me.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Just now when Johnny Ola showed up, he asked me to leave them alone. Ola is Hyman Roth's Sicilian contact.  I was on the inside of ten, twenty meetings with him.  But today Mike asked me to leave, like an outsider.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Talk to him.  Tell him how you feel.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: It's as though he blames me for the ground the family lost when I was Consigliere to Sonny.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: She's gone, Tom.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: What do you mean gone?

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: The Barretts from Rubicon Bay came by in a new speedboat.  Rocco tried to say she wasn't in, but Kay spotted them and asked if they would take her and the kids for a ride.  That was three hours ago.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Why didn't someone tell me!

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: I wanted to tell you alone; your wife doesn't know what's going on.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: You're going to talk to him now.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDRA
turns.text: Will you tell him?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Rocco!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I know.  I went down to the Barrett house.  But she's gone.  They drove her and the kids to North Tahoe airport.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Goddamn it, where were you?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I was in my house.  Willy tried, but it would have taken some strong-arm to stop her, and he figured you wouldn't want that.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: She took a flight to San Francisco. We figure she's going to connect to New Hampshire; her parents' place.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I can't let him down.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Me too, Tom?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yeah, give me a minute.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I'm sorry; of course, you know that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Two-thirty.  That gives me time to see my boy.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Connie's outside.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Tom isn't going to sit in with us, Johnny.  He only handles specific areas of the family business.  Tom?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Sure, Mikey.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: If you need anything, just...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just tell Rocco I'm waiting.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: There's a lot I can't tell you, Tom. I know that's upset you in the past; and you've felt that it was because of some lack of trust or confidence.  But it is because I do trust you that I've kept so much secret from you.  It's precisely that at this moment, you are the only one that I can completely trust.  In time, you'll understand everything.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: But your people... Neri... Rocco; you don't think...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, I have confidence in their loyalty... but this is life and death, and Tom, you are my brother.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Mikey, I hoped...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No Tom, just listen.  All my people are businessmen; their loyalty is based on that.  One thing I learned from my father is to try to think as the people around you think...and on that basis, anything is possible. Fredo has a good heart, but he is weak...and stupid, and stupid people are the most dangerous of all.  I've kept you out of things, Tom, because I've always known that your instincts were legitimate, and I wanted you to know very little of things that would make you an accomplice, for your own protection. I never blamed you for the setbacks the family took under Sonny; I know you were in a position of limited power, and you did your best to advise and caution him.  What I am saying is that now, for how long I do not know, you will be the Don. If what I think has happened is true; I will leave tonight, and absolutely no one will know how to contact me.  And even you are not to try to reach me unless it is absolutely necessary.  I give you complete power: over Neri... Fredo, everyone.  I am trusting you with the lives of my wife and children, and the future of this family, solely resting on your judgment and talent.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've prepared this; have had it for over a month.  It won't explain everything; but indicates where I will be, so in a sense, it is my life.  Also, there are three tasks that must be executed immediately.  Pop would have given those to Luca -- You knew Pop as well as anyone, act as though you were him.  It discusses Kay as well; that will be the most difficult.  The men who tried to kill me tonight, will never leave the estate.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Will we...be able to get who ordered it out of them?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't think so.  Unless I'm very wrong...they're already dead. Killed by someone inside...very frightened that they botched it. That's why I am going to disappear in a few minutes, and leave everything to you.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: But if you're wrong...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: If I'm wrong...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Do you think they have somebody to back up Cicci?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: No.  But if they do have somebody, you'll do three years for perjury if you give them so much as a wrong middle name.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Did the boy get something from me for Christmas?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I took care of it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What was it, so I'll know.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: A little care he can ride in with an electric motor.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where's my brother?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Roth got out on a private boat. He's in a hospital in Miami.  Had a stroke but he's recovered okay. Bussetta's dead.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I asked about Fredo?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: The new government arrested him, held him for a couple of days with a lot of the other casino people, including Roth's brother, Sam.  The American Embassy arranged flights for citizens; I'm not sure, but I think he's somewhere in New York.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I want you to reach Fredo.  I know he's scared, but have one of our people reach him.  Assure him that there will be no reprisals.  Tell him that I know Roth misled him.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: My information is that Fredo thought it was a kidnapping.  Roth assured him nothing would happen to you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: They can come in now.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Wait... there's something else.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Go on, tell me.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Kay had a miscarriage; she lost the baby.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Was it a boy or a girl?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Mike, at three and a half...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What is it, can't you give me straight answers anymore!

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: It was a boy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And Kay...she's all right?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: She took the Senate Investigation worse.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Does she blame it on me?  The baby?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How did they get their hands on Pentangeli?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Roth engineered it, Michael.  He made Pentangeli think you hit him. Deliberately letting him get off alive.  Then the New York detectives turned Frankie over to the FBI.  My informants say he was half dead and scared stiff -- talking out loud that you had turned on him and tried to kill him.  Anyway, they had him on possession, dealing in heroin, murder one and a lot more. There's no way we can get to him and you've opened yourself to five points of perjury.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: He says he doesn't know anything, and I believe him.  Roth played this one beautifully.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Alright.  I'm going to go outside and talk to Fredo.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sit down, Tom.  Have you heard about our friend and partner, Mr. Hyman Roth?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I know he's in Israel.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: They won't take him; not for a million, not for ten million.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: His medical condition is reported as... "terminal."

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He's been dying of the same heart attack for twenty years.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: That plane goes to Miami...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I want it met.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Mike, it's impossible.  He'll be met by the Internal Revenue; the Customs Service, and half the FBI.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't like it when you use the word impossible; nothing is impossible...

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Mike, it would be like trying to kill the President; there's no way we can get to him.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm surprised at you, Tom.  If there's anything certain; certain in life; if history has taught us anything, it's that you can kill...  ANYBODY.  But perhaps your relucatance is because you've come to tell me that you're moving your family to Vegas, that you've been offered the Vice-Presidency of the Houstan Hotels there.  Or weren't you going to tell me at all?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Are you so hungry for traitors; do you want to find them everywhere?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: They are everywhere!

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I turned Houstan down; I didn't see why I should tell you about an offer I turned down.  Are you sure, Mikey?  Are you sure of what we're doing; what we'll gain; what does the family gain? Forget that, Mike; I already know the answer.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know you do, Tom.  Then I can count on you to help me do the things I have to do.  If not, call Houstan, and become a Vice-President. Take your family and your mistress and move them to Las Vegas.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Why do you hurt me, Michael?  I've always been loyal to you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Good.  Then you're staying.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I'm staying.  Don't ever enjoy the cruel part of all this; Sonny never listened to me about that.  Now, explain everything to me.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: Fifteen percent skim?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Twenty-five this time.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: It might show.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Mike wants it.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: We've never sent this much with one courier.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Your plans are a little different this time.  You skip Miami, and go straight to Geneva.  It's to be deposited to this number.  And it's got to be there by Monday morning, no slip-up.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: No questions.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: I got to ask questions, Tom, there's three million dollars cash in that pouch; Mike is gone and I have no word from him.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Al, as far as you're concerned, I'm the Don.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: How do I know you haven't gone into business for yourself?

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: The High Court of Israel turned down his request to live as a 'returned Jew.' His passport's been invalidated except for return to the U.S.  He landed in Buenos Aires yesterday, offered a gift of one million dollars if they would give him citizenship.  They turned him down.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: He's going to try Panama...

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I think I prefer to see my client privately.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: The room has a bug in it.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: I'd like to go outside with him, in the open air.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Everything is going to be okay, Frankie, don't worry.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Did my brother go back?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yeah, but don't worry.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: He's ten times tougher than me, my brother.  He's old-fashioned.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yeah.  He wouldn't even go out to dinner.  Just wanted to go home.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: That's my brother.  Nothing could get him away from that two mule town.  He coulda been big over here -- he could of had his own Family.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Tom, what do I do now?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Frankie, you were always interested in politics, in history.  I remember you talking about Hitler back in '43.  We were young then.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Yeah, I still read a lot.  They bring me stuff.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: You were around the old timers who dreamed up how the Families should be organized, how they based it on the old Roman Legions, and called them 'Regimes'... with the 'Capos' and 'Soldiers,' and it worked.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Yeah, it worked.  Those were great old days.  We was like the Roman Empire.  The Corleone family was like the Roman Empire.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yeah, it was once.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: The Roman Empire... when a plot against the Emperor failed, the plotters were always given a chance to let their families keep their fortunes.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Yeah, but only the rich guys.  The little guys got knocked off.  If they got arrested and executed, all their estate went to the Emperor. If they just went home and killed themselves, up front, nothing happened.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yeah, that was a good break.  A nice deal.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Don't worry about anything, Frankie Five-Angels.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Thanks, Tom.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: ...and the tape will be running.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Actually, I've come with good news; the Corleone family has done you a favor.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: We know you're a busy man, with plenty of enemies -- we saw the opportunity to do you a favor, and we did.  No strings.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: No strings.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: You know there's a Senate Investigating Committee recently set up; we thought it would be unfortunate if they were to trace anything though-provoking to your name.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: No one can trace anything to me; I pride myself on that.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Do you gamble?

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: A little; what's so thought- provoking about that?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Do you owe markers?

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: Maybe two, three thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: There's thirty grand worth of paid off markers -- I never owed that much.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Our mistake.  But what does it matter; it was our money.  We don't even expect thanks.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: You paid off thirty grand I never owed.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: We'll keep it quiet; the people who know are trustworthy...the Committee needn't find out.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: And what's the price of their not finding out.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Simple.  Be friendly like us.  Not hostile.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: Thanks...friend.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Senator, my client would like to read a statement for the record.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: I don't think that's necessary.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Sir, my client has answered every question asked by this committee with the utmost cooperation and sincerity.  He has not taken that Fifth Amendment as it was his right to do, and which because of the extreme legal complexity of this hearing, counsel advised him to do. So, I think in all fairness this committee should hear his statement and put it in the record.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Mr. Hagen, would you kindly identify to this committee that gentleman sitting on your right hand?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Yes, sir.  His name is Vincenzo Pentangeli.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Is he related to the witness?

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: He is, I believe, a brother.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Sir, the gentleman does not understand English.  He would not in any case, take the stand.  He came, at his own expense, to aid his brother in his trouble.  He is not under any jurisdiction of our government and his reputation in his own country is impeccable.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: The witness is excused; take him out.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: Senator Kane.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: This meeting is adjourned.

turns.speaker: HAGEN
turns.text: This committee owes an apology!

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: The committee is adjourned until further notice.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mrs. Corleone.  We're not to let you through.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm going to the market.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If you could just give us a list, we'll pick up anything you want.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Whose orders are these?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Mr. Hagen's, ma'am.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Anthony, Daddy's busy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This is my boy, and my wife.  Mr. John Ola of Miami.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Michael.  Senator Geary's here, and Mr. and Mrs. Barrett wanted to thank you before they left.  Won't you join us, Mr. Ola?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mr. Ola's just leaving, Kay. Please tell the Senator I won't be a minute.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Kay.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yes, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How's the baby?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Sleeping inside me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Does it feel like a boy?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yes, Michael, it does.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm sorry about some of the people I had to see today.  It was bad timing... but it couldn't be helped.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It made me think of what you told me once.  In five years, the Corleone family will be completely legitimate.  That was seven years ago.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Leave her alone!  You're talking as though she has no right to be frightened when there are machine guns going off in her backyard.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Have Tom Hagen meet me in the Harbor House.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I had no idea...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I wanted to see you before you went back to Nevada.  Also, the children - Michael, they're here.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: In a minute.  They're outside with Esther.  I'm very happy for you... I suppose I knew that you're simply too smart for anyone ever to beat you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why don't you sit down?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm not going to stay long; I can't.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: There are a lot of things I want to talk to you about.  Things I've been thinking about -- changes I want to make.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I think it's too late for changes, Michael.  I promised myself I wouldn't talk about it and I've gone and spoiled it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why too late?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Tell me, Michael.  What really happened with Pentangeli?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: His brother came to help him.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I didn't even know he had a brother. And where is he now?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: On a plane back to Sicily.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: And that's all he had to do.  Just show his face.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's all.  You see, in Sicily, in the old days... there was only one legitimate reason to kill a blood relative... only one.  IF he was a traitor.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You would have killed his brother?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Kay, you've got it wrong.  That kind of thing's all over, I promised you.  This was between the two brothers.  Years ago Frankie had a young girlfriend; he called her his co-wife.  That was his joke, but he meant it.  He wouldn't divorce his wife... because she was a great cook.  He said he girlfriend made a spaghetti sauce once and it was so terrible he knew he could never marry her.  He set her up in a house in Jersey.  She had to be faithful... and she had to have kids. And she did, two, a boy and a girl. He had her checked out and watched so she couldn't cheat... but the girl couldn't stand that kind of life.  She begged him to let her go. He did.  He gave her money and made her give up the kids.  Then Frankie took them to Italy, and had them brought up by his brother Vincenzo. Where he knew they'd by safe.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: When he saw his brother in the hearing room, he knew what was at stake.  I don't think Vincenzo would have done it.  He loves the kids, too. Omerta, Kay.  Honor, silence.  It had nothing to do with me.  It was between those brothers.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'll bring the children up now; they want to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Kay, I told you...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Goodbye, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I won't let you leave!  Christ, do you think I'm going to let you leave.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, I don't want to hear anything. There are things between men and women that will not change; things that have been the same for thousands of years.  You are my wife, and they are my children... and I love you and I will not let you leave, because you are MINE!

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Oh, I do feel things for you, Michael; but now, I think it's pity. For the first time since I've known you, you seem so helpless.  You held me a prisoner once; will you try again?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: If that's what it takes; then yes, I will.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: At this moment, I feel no love for you at all.  I never thought that could happen, but it has.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We'll go back tonight.  Bring the children.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: You haven't heard me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How can I let you leave; how can I let you take my children away? Don't you know me?  You understand, it's an impossibility.  I would never let it happen; no, never, not if it took all my strength, all my cunning.  But in time, soon, you'll feel differently.  You see, you'll be happy that I stopped you.  I know you.  You'll forget about this; you'll forget about the baby we lost... and we'll go on, you and I.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: The baby I lost...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know what it meant... and I'm prepared to make it up to you.  I will make changes; I can.  I CAN change; that I have learned, that I have the strength to change... And we have another child, a boy... and you'll forget the miscarriage.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: It wasn't a miscarriage.  And you with your cunning, couldn't you figure it out!  It was an abortion; an abortion, like our marriage is an abortion, something unholy and evil.  I don't want your son; I wouldn't bring another of your sons into this world.  An abortion, Michael... it was a son, and I had it killed, but this must all end!

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: Are you Klingman?

turns.speaker: KLINGMAN
turns.text: Who's asking?

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: Where can we talk?

turns.speaker: KLINGMAN
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: I represent the interests of the Corleone family.  We make the invitation to you to tie up your affairs and be out of the hotel by Monday morning.

turns.speaker: KLINGMAN
turns.text: Who do you think you're talking to?

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: You said you were Klingman.

turns.speaker: KLINGMAN
turns.text: You don't come in here, talk to an owner in Las Vegas like that.

turns.speaker: NERI
turns.text: You missed my point; you are no longer an owner.

turns.speaker: KLINGMAN
turns.text: Get out of my hotel.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's Michael.  How are you, Mom?

turns.speaker: MAMA
turns.text: I'm alright.  Will you stay home for awhile?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: There are still things I have to do.

turns.speaker: MAMA
turns.text: Well, we can all have a nice dinner together tonight.  How are your eyes?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Alright.  They bother me once in awhile.  Tell me, when Pop had troubles... did he ever think, even to himself, that he had gone the wrong way; that maybe by trying to be strong and trying to protect his family, that he could... that he could... lose it instead?

turns.speaker: MAMA
turns.text: You talk about the baby.  She can have another baby.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, I meant lose his family.

turns.speaker: MAMA
turns.text: Your family?  How can you ever lose your family?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: But times are different...

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Sit down, this is almost over.  You follow the baseball games?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Not for a few years.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: I like sporting events -- I really enjoy watching them in the afternoon. One of the things I love about this country.  I loved baseball ever since Arnold Rothstein fixed the World Series of 1919...I heard you had some trouble.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: What a mistake; people behaving like that, with guns.  It was my understanding we left all that behind.  But, let me tell you, the important thing is that you're all right.  Good health is the most important thing; more than success; more than power; more than money.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The incident of the other night is a nuisance that I can take care of. I came to you because I want nothing to affect our agreement; I wanted to clear everything I'm going to do with you, just in case.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: You're a considerate young man.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're a great man, Mr. Roth, I have much to learn from you.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: However I can help you...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The Rosato Brothers have performed services for you in the past; I understand that they are under your protection.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: We do favors for each other...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Technically, they are still under the Clemenza wing of the Corleone Family, now run by Frankie Pentangeli.  After Clemenza died, the Rosatos wanted territory of their own.  Pentangeli refused, and came to me, asking for permission to eliminate them.  I, of course, knew of their relationship with you, and in gratitude for your help with the Tropicana matter, turned him down.  Pentangeli was furious, and paid one hundred and fifty thousand dollars to have me killed. I was lucky and he was stupid. I'll visit him soon.  The important thing is that nothing jeopardize our plans, yours and mine.  This thing of ours, that we will build.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Nothing is more important.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Pentangeli is a dead man; do you object?

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: It's always bad for business; but you have no choice.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Then it's done.  I must choose his replacement: it cannot be Rosato.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Of course you must keep control of your family.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: I still don't speak Spanish, Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It means... "The Lie."

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Enjoy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I saw an interesting thing today. A man was being arrested by the Military Police; probably an urban guerrilla.  Rather than be taken alive, he exploded a grenade hidden in his jacket, taking the command vehicle with him.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: You have to be careful what you say in front of the others... they frighten easy.  It's always been that way, most men frighten easy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We're making a big investment in Cuba.  That's my only concern.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: My concern is that the three million never arrived at Batista's numbered account in Switzerland. He thinks it's because you have second thoughts about his ability to stop the rebels.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The money was sent.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Then you have to trace it.  Michael, people here look at me as a reliable man.  I can't afford not to be looked on as a reliable man.  But you know all that; there's nothing you can learn from me.  You shouldn't have to put up with a sick old man as a partner.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I wouldn't consider anyone else.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Except the President of the United States.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: If only I could live to see it, kid; to be there with you.  How beautifully we've done it, step by step.  Here, protected, free to make our profits without the Justice Department, the FBI; ninety miles away in partnership with a friendly government.  Ninety miles, just a small step, looking for a man who desperately wants to be President of the United States, and having the cash to make it possible.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You'll be there to see it; you'll be there.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This doubles my investment.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Still no word of your courier? We'll find him.  But at least this will satisfy our friends here. You've been invited to the New Year reception at the Presidential Home. I understand your brother is here as well; I hope he'll come.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Six million dollars in cash is a high price for a piece of a country in the middle of a revolution.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: You're a careful kid, and that's good.  But look.  An international dispatch on the wire service. American journalism, not propaganda. The government troops have all but eliminated the rebels.  All but their radio station.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've read it; I'm pleased that the government is doing so well.  As a heavy investor, I'm pleased.  How did the doctor find you?

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Terrible.  I'd give twice this amount to take a piss without it hurting.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Who had Frankie Pantangeli killed?

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: Why...the Rosato Brothers.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know that; but who gave the go ahead.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know it wasn't me...so that leaves you.

turns.speaker: ROTH
turns.text: There was this kid that I grew up with; he was a couple years younger than me, and sort of looked up to me, you know.  We did our first work together, worked our way out of the street.  Things were good and we made the most of it.  During prohibition, we ran molasses up to Canada and made a fortune; your father too.  I guess as much as anyone, I loved him and trusted him. Later on he had an idea to make a city out of a desert stop-over for G.I.'s on the way to the West Coast. That kid's name was Moe Greene, and the city he invented was Las Vegas. This was a great man; a man with vision and guts; and there isn't even a plaque or a signpost or a statue of him in that town.  Someone put a bullet through his eye; no one knows who gave the order.  When I heard about it I wasn't angry.  I knew Moe; I knew he was headstrong, and talking loud, and saying stupid things.  So when he turned up dead, I let it go, and said to myself: this is the business we've chosen. I never asked, who gave the go ahead because it had nothing to do with business.

turns.speaker: SAM ROTH
turns.text: Hiya, Mr. Corleone, I'm Sam Roth. Welcome to the Capri; my brother's upstairs.  You wanta take a rest before you see him, or can I get you something, anything at all?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: SAM ROTH
turns.text: This is it!  We think it makes Vegas look like the corner crap game.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Very impressive.

turns.speaker: SAM ROTH
turns.text: Jake, Jake, come over here.  Mike, I want you to meet Jake Cohen; he manages the casino for us.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It occurred to me: the police are paid to fight, and the Rebels are not.

turns.speaker: SAM ROTH
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So, that occurred to me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You know my lawyer, Tom Hagen. Johnny Ola.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: Sure, I remember Tom from the old days.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: I just left our friend in Miami.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How is his health?

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: Not good.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Is there anything I can do; anything I can send?

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: He appreciates your concern, Michael, and your respect.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: The hotel's registered owners are one Jacob Lawrence, and Sidney Barclay, both Beverly Hills attorneys.  In reality it's split between the Old Lakeville Road Group from Cleveland, and our friend in Miami.  He takes care of others outside the country, you know who I mean.  Meyer Klingman runs the store, and does all right, but I've been instructed to tell you, that if you move him out, our friend in Miami will go along with you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He's very kind, tell him it's appreciated.  I'm sure it will be profitable all the way around.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: He always makes money for his partners.  One by one, our old friends are gone.  Death, natural or not, prison, deported.  Our friend in Miami is the only one left, because he always made money for his partners.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: They asked him to sign paper to take down the markers; but he got mad; told them to wait until he was finished.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Let him gamble.

turns.speaker: OLA
turns.text: Okay.  You know he doesn't have that kind of money.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Are you the son of Vito Corleone?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: I'm sure we all agree with our esteemed colleague.  Now, Mr. Corleone, you have been advised as to your legal rights.  We have had testimony from a preceding witness who states you are head of the most powerful Mafia family in this country.  Are you?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: This witness has testified that you are personally responsible for the murder of a New York Police Captain in the year 1947 and with him a man named Virgil Sollozzo.  Do you deny this?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I deny his every charge.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Is it true that in the year 1950 you devised the murder of the heads of the Five Families in New York, to assume and consolidate your nefarious power?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That is a complete falsehood.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Is it true that you own a controlling interest in three of the major hotels in Las Vegas?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That is not true.  I own some stock in some of the hotels, but only very small amounts.  I also own some American Telephone and IBM stock.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Mr. Corleone, do you have any hotel interests in the state of Arizona? Or any gambling interests in that state?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I do not.

turns.speaker: SENATOR KANE
turns.text: Do you have interests or control over gambling and narcotics in the state of New York.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I do not.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: When do we talk?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: After dinner.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Sure, Pete Clemenza died of a heart attack, but the Rosato Brothers gave it to him.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We were all heartbroken at the news; but that wasn't cause to start a war.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Okay, now it's my family in Brooklyn; and I wanna keep up Clemenza's loyalty to you.  But how can I run my family with you challenging my every move?  You're too far from the street, Mike, the only way to reason with the Rosato Brothers is to whack 'em and whack 'em fast.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You were unfair with them.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Says who?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Clemenza promised Rosato three territories in the Bronx after he died, and then you took over and welched.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Clemenza promised them nothing, he hated the sonsuvbitches.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: They feel cheated.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Michael, you're sitting up here in the Sierra Mountains with champagne cocktails making judgment on the way I run my family.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Your family still carries the name Corleone, and you will run it like a Corleone!

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: And while I feed my family in New York, you put the knife in my back in Miami.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Frankie, you're a good old man, and you've been loyal to my Father for years...so I hope you can explain what you mean.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: The Rosatos are running crazy; taking hostages, spitting in my face, because they're backed by the Jew in Miami.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know.  That's why I want you to be fair with them.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: How can you be fair with animals? They recruit niggers and spicks; they do violence in their own Grandmother's neighborhoods.  And everything is dope and whores; the gambling is left to last.  Let me run my family without you on my back.  I want them taken care of.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.  There are things that I have planned with Hyman Roth.  I don't want them disturbed.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: You give your loyalty to a Jew over your own blood.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Frankie, you know my father respected Roth, did business with him.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: He did business...but he never trusted him.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Don Corleone, I wish you let me know you was coming.  We could have prepared something for you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I didn't want you to know I was coming.  You heard what happened in my home?

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Michael, yes, we was all relieved...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: In my home!  In the same room where my wife was sleeping; where my children come in their pajamas, and play with their toys.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I want you to help me take my revenge.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Michael, anything.  What is it I can do for you?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I want you to settle these troubles with the Rosato Brothers.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: I was just going to contact you, Michael; we just had a 'sit-down' - in fact, I just come from there.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I want you to settle on their terms.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Mike, I don't understand.  Don't ask me to do that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Trust me; do as I ask.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: It would be the beginning of the end for my family.  How can I keep all my other territories in like if I let two wise-guys stand up and demand this and that, and then give it to them?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Frankie...do you respect me?  Do I have your loyalty?

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Always... But sometimes I don't understand.  I know I'll never have your kind of brains, in big deals. But Mike, this is a street thing. And Hyman Roth in Miami is behind the Rosato Brothers.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Then why do you want me to lay down to them?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Frankie, Roth tried to have me killed.  I'm sure it was him, but I don't know yet why.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Michael, then let's hit 'em now, while we still got the muscle.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This was my father's old study. When I was a kid, we had to be quiet when we played near here. When I was older, I learned many things from him here.  I was happy that this house never went to strangers; first Clemenza took it over, and then you.  My father taught me, in this room, never to act until you know everything that's behind things.  Never.  If Hyman Roth sees that I interceded with you in the Rosato Brothers' favor, he'll think his relationship with me is still sound.  I'm going somewhere to meet him tomorrow.  We have friends in some very important business that we're making.  Do this for me; you make the peace with the Rosato Brothers on their terms.  Let the word out that I forced you; you're not happy wit hit, but acquiesced, just because of me.  It will get back to Hyman Roth.  Do this, Frankie.  You can trust me.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Sure, Mike.  I'll go along.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: My lawyer, Tom Hagen.  He arranged this all through your man Turnbull.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: I thought we would meet alone.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I trust these men with my life. They are my right arms; I cannot insult them by sending them away.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: Some water.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: The Corleone family controls two major hotels in Vegas; one in Reno. The licenses were grandfathered in, so you had no difficulties with the Gaming Commission.  But I have the idea from sources...  ...that you're planning to move in on the Tropicana.  In another week or so you'll move Klingman out, which leaves you with only one technicality.  The license, which is now in Klingman's name.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Turnbull is a good man.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: Let's forget the bullshit, I don't want to stay here any longer than I have to.  You can have the license for two hundred and fifty thousand in cash, plus a monthly fee equal to five percent of the gross...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Senator Geary, I speak to you as a businessman who has made a large investment in your state.  I have made that state my home; plan to raise my children here.  The license fee from the Gambling Commission costs one thousand dollars; why would I ever consider paying more?

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: I'm going to squeeze you, Corleone, because I don't like you; I don't like the kind of man you are.  I despise your masquerade, and the dishonest way you pose yourself and your fucking family.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We're all part of the same hypocrisy, Senator.  But never think it applies to my family.

turns.speaker: SENATOR GEARY
turns.text: All right, then let me say you'll pay me because it's in your interests to pay me.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: They're still on the property. Maybe you better stay inside.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Keep them alive.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: We'll try.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's important.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Your family all seem to be okay in the other houses; your Mother's still sleeping.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: No sign of them yet; but they're still on the Estate.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: On the phone?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: No, she's here.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Rosato, where's your brother?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: Sitting right behind you.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: He don't want to talk?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: We worked it all out beforehand.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Are we going to eat or what?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: Sure, on me.  I got Diner's Club.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Forget it; I'm suddenly without an appetite.  You're making big trouble, Carmine.

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: You weren't straight with us, Frankie, what else could we do?

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: We could have talked first, saved a lot of running around.

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: You wasn't listening, you didn't want to talk.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Don't I look like I'm listening?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: We want Brooklyn one hundred percent.  No more taxes to you.  We want to be only loosely connected with your family -- sort of a under-family all of our own.  Then we can act on all internal matters without talking.  Also we want you to inform Michael Corleone that we can deal directly with him.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: I'm a little hungry, maybe I'll order something.  Joe.  Get me some bracciole or something. And pay cash.  And in return for these concessions, what do you do for me?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: We will release the hostages, number one.  Number two, we're here for you to count on when you need us.  We're independent, but we're here if you need us.  In general, we'll cooperate with you and your businesses, and you in turn will cooperate with us.  Pari persu.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: Pari Persu; what the fuck is Pari persu...?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: My lawyer went over this beforehand.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: What assurances do I have that there will be no more kidnapping, no more hits?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: The same assurance we got from you.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: What if I say shove it?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: Then Carmine Fucillo and Tony Blue DeRosa will need to be fitted for slabs.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: You want a war?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: We got no choice.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: You know if there's a way I'll go to the commission and the commission will side with me.  That puts me and the other New York families against you.

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: We got friends in the commission.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: I'm talking about Italians!

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: What about Michael Corleone?

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: He supports me.

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: Maybe, yes... maybe no.

turns.speaker: PENTANGELI
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: ROSATO
turns.text: That's a lucky C note for our new deal.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: I have already rented the apartment to another family.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: I told her I would speak to you, that you are a reasonable man who acted out of some misunderstanding. She has gotten rid of the animal that caused all the trouble, so why shouldn't she stay.  As one Italian to another, I ask you the favor.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: I've already rented it; I cannot disappoint the new tenants.  They're paying a higher rent.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: How much more a month?

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Eh...  Five dollars more.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Here is the six month's increase in advance.  You needn't speak to her about it, she's a proud woman.  See me again in another six months. But of course, you'll let her keep her dog.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Like hell!  And who the hell are you to give me orders.  Watch your manners or you'll be on your Sicilian ass in the street there.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: Excuse me, I hope I am not a disturbance, Don Corleone.

turns.speaker: VITO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROBERTO
turns.text: What a terrible misunderstanding. Of course, Signora Colombo can stay in the flat.  Who were those miserable tenants to complain about noise from a poor animal...when they pay such low rent.
